Detailed Description

Base class for OPP servers within applications.

The present class offers an interface to run OPP (Object Push Pull) over OBEX as a server. All instances of this interface share the common internal implementation class ObexServerOppImpl which contains the protocol automaton. Multiple instances of this interface can be used simultaneously by the application layer, but only one OPP connection at a time is supported. Hence any incoming OPP operation will be rejected when on is already being processed.

Dispatching of OPP requests is done based on the MIME type of the object to be pushed or pulled, therefore an OPP server must register at least on object type passed as a constructor or Init() method parameter. Each server can subscribe to additional MIME types by using the BindToMimeType() method, but each MIME type might be bound to only one OPP server. Therefore, if two OPP servers try to register the same MIME type, Open() will fail when called on the second server instance.

When only a PUSH service is required, it is much more comfortable to use the front-end class ObexOppDataSinkPushServer as this will spare application SW the tedious job of data buffer management and segmentation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexOppServer::ObexOppServer (   ) 
 

Default constructor.

Default-constructed instances must be initialized using Init() before using them the first time.

MimeType  mime_type
) 
 

Constructor. Constructs a usable object instance.

Intended to be used with dynamically allocated objects (new).

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Pointer to an execution context in which the server should be run.
mime_type Mime type of the objects the server is interested in.

Accepts an incoming PUSH operation.

ObexResult ObexOppServer::BindToMimeType (  MimeType  mime_type  ) 
 

Binds the server to an additional mime type.

When the same type of processing is desired for several different mimetypes (for example, saving images to the filesystem) it is more convenient and also resource - saving to bind the same server to multiple mime types than running a seperate server instance for each mime type. This can be accomplished by calling BindToMimeType() on the server for each of the additional MIME types to be handled.

Caution: The server should be in closed state when calling this method. Each mime type may be registered by only one server.

Parameters:
mime_type MIME type identifier.
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

Reimplemented in ObexOppDataSinkPushServer.

const WString &  resp_desc = WString()
) 
 

Rejects an incoming or cancels an already ongoing PUSH or PULL operation.

ObexResult ObexOppServer::DataProcessed (   ) 
 

Acknowledges processing of a received PUSH data buffer.

Only to be used when ObexOppServer has ownership of the buffer.

ObexResult ObexOppServer::DataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  app_data  ) 
 

Acknowledges processing of a received PUSH data buffer.

This call invalidates the buffer which must not be accessed by the application afterwards.

Parameters:
app_data ObexBuffer which was passed in OnDataAvailable().

UINT32 ObexOppServer::GetProgressInBytes (   )  const
 

Returns the cumulative progress in transferring data.

This method returns the amount of data already transferred for a pending PUSH (inbound data) or PULL (outbound data) operation. The final value is preserved even beyond completion of that operation, hence it is reset to '0' when a new operation is accepted.

Reimplemented in ObexOppDataSinkPushServer.

void ObexOppServer::OnDataAvailable (  ObexBuffer &  app_data,
BOOLEAN  end_data
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Offers the next chunk of data to the application.

The application may now access the data provided by the ObexBuffer object. After data processing has been completed, the application must call DataProcessed() on the buffer object. This invalidates the buffer and tells the client to ask for the next chunk of data.

Parameters:
app_data Buffer which holds the data pushed by the remote client.
end_data Tells whether this is the last chunk of data delivered by the remote client.

void ObexOppServer::OnDataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  buffer  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Returns ownership of a buffer back to the application.

The passed data buffer had been produced by the application and may be now either recycled or disposed.

Parameters:
buffer ObexBuffer belonging to the application.

void ObexOppServer::OnPull (  const WString &  obj_name,
const String &  obj_type
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming pull operation.

Parameters:
obj_name Name of the object to be pulled from the server.
obj_type Mime string of the object to be pulled. Unless the server is not the default one, this should always match the MimeType it registered for at construction time.

void ObexOppServer::OnPullComplete (  ObexResult  result,
const WString &  description
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates completion of a PULL operation.

Parameters:
result Evaluates to 'TRUE' when the operation was completed successfully, 'FALSE' otherwise.
description In case of unsuccessful completion of an operation this parameter optionally contains a verbal description of the error cause.

void ObexOppServer::OnPush (  const WString &  obj_name,
const String &  obj_type,
const WString &  obj_desc,
UINT32  obj_size
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming push operation.

Parameters:
obj_name Name of the object being pushed.
obj_type Mime string of the object being pushed. Unless the server is not the default one, this should always match the MimeType it registered for at construction time.
obj_desc Textual description of the object content.
obj_size Size of the whole object (may be larger than the size of a singe data buffer. If the size equals '0', it is not yet known.

ObexResult ObexOppServer::UnbindMimeType (  MimeType  mime_type  ) 
 

Unbinds the server from a mime type.

Calling UnbindMimeType() removes the binding to the specified mimetype to the server.

Caution: The server should be in closed state when calling this method.

Parameters:
type_info MIME type identifier.
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' is case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

Reimplemented in ObexOppDataSinkPushServer.
